ModMetaData.name: [PL] Prioritized Kill Dev Tool
ModMetaData.author: ProgrammerLily
ModMetaData.description:
A smart replacement for RimWorld's vanilla "Kill" debug tool that intelligently prioritizes targets instead of killing everything indiscriminately.
üéØ INTELLIGENT TARGETING Instead of destroying everything under your cursor, this mod kills only the most relevant target based on a logical priority system. Perfect for developers and modders who need precision control.
‚ö° PRIORITY SYSTEM (Highest ‚Üí Lowest) 1. Hostile Pawns - Raiders, manhunters, hostile faction members 2. Mechanoids - Both active and dormant mechanoids 3. Wild Animals - Including manhunters and aggressive wildlife 4. Items - Weapons, apparel, resources, dropped goods 5. Buildings - Structures, furniture, doors, turrets 6. Corpses - Dead bodies and remains 7. Environmental - Filth, plants, debris, neutral objects 8. Friendlies - Colonists and tamed animals (safety last)

‚öôÔ∏è CUSTOMIZATION OPTIONS Access full configuration through: Options ‚Üí Mod Settings ‚Üí Prioritized Kill Tool ‚Ä¢ Enable/disable any of the 8 target categories ‚Ä¢ Toggle between single-target and area-effect modes ‚Ä¢ Adjust kill radius from 0.5 to 10 tiles ‚Ä¢ Configure distance prioritization preferences ‚Ä¢ Control debug message visibility ‚Ä¢ One-click reset to safe defaults
üîß DEVELOPER FRIENDLY Perfect for mod testing, map cleanup, and precise debugging. Saves time by eliminating the need to manually select specific targets in crowded scenes while maintaining the safety and power of the original tool.
Compatible with all other mods. No performance impact during normal gameplay.
